author: gstein
msg: When running cleanup, we need our specially-opened DB for ALL the subdirs,
(can_be_cleaned): new utility function to fetch a directory's format and
run a couple tests on it. extracted from svn_wc_cleanup3().
(cleanup_internal): check if the directory can be cleaned, and get the
format number. that number is used to determine whether a workqueue
even exists in this directory. run cleanup for "." before the children.
(svn_wc_cleanup3): don't bother checking the directory or running its
workqueue. cleanup_internal() will do all that. also, use our special
DB for the whole operation, not just "."

author: hwright
msg: Introduce a new macro to flush an existing LOG_ACCUM buffer, and use it to
start breaking up log entries into separate work queue items.
(remove_revert_files, process_committed_leaf): Use the new macro liberally.
(SVN_WC__FLUSH_LOG_ACCUM): A new macro for flushing a log_accum string

author: julianfoad
msg: Update doc strings to reflect WC-NG changes. Update them where an ADM_ACCESS
parameter has been replaced with a WC-NG alternative or removed, and (only in
those same doc strings) where path parameters have been renamed, usually to
LOCAL_ABSPATH or similar. Add "TODO" comments where the required change was
not clear or other parameters were undocumented.
Throughout these files, update doc strings as described above.

author: gstein
msg: The new svn_wc__db_global_commit() function takes a hash of new properties
for the dav-cache. This revision begins the process of carrying around a
hash in the commit logic, rather than an array of changes.
We also break the post-commit setting of the dav-cache off the end of the
batch of post-commit work, and use a new work item in the queue to make the
(run_set_dav_cache, svn_wc__wq_set_dav_cache): new functions to run and
(process_committed_leaf): queue all the loggy work up to the wcprop
work. use the new workqueue operation for the wcprops, after building

author: hwright
msg: De-spaghetti some props writing code.  This has the happy side-effect of
making loggy_write_properties() clearer, and it's callers a bit saner, too.
A single function should not be overloaded for both loggy and non-loggy writing.
(immediate_install_props): Do the work here, rather than overloading a
function to do write the properties out.
(run_prepare_revert_files): Create the required empty revert props file
manually, instead of overloading another function to do it for us.
